fields.label: Check for general danger signs:

options.text: Child is not able to drink or breastfeed

fields.text:
Child Has: VERY SEVERE DISEASE 
- Quickly complete the rest of this assessment 
- Give any pre-referral treatment immediately 
- Treat to prevent low blood sugar 
- Keep the child warm 
- Refer URGENTLY
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child Has: VERY SEVERE DISEASE 
- Quickly complete the rest of this assessment 
- Give any pre-referral treatment immediately 
- Treat to prevent low blood sugar 
- Keep the child warm 
- Refer URGENTLY

fields.label: CHILD IS CONVULSING NOW: Give diazepam
Does the child have any of these symptoms?

fields.text:
Child has no danger signs or symptoms . 
Follow-up with the caregiver to make sure the child stays healthy.
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has no danger signs or symptoms . 
Follow-up with the caregiver to make sure the child stays healthy.

fields.label: Does the child have cough or difficult breathing?

fields.hint: How many days has the child had a cough or difficult breathing?

v_required.err: Please enter the number of days

fields.text:
Procedure:
- Count the breaths in one minute. 
- Look for chest indrawing.
- Look and listen for stridor.
- Look and listen for wheezing.
fields.toaster_info_text:
Procedure:
- Count the breaths in one minute. 
- Look for chest indrawing.
- Look and listen for stridor.
- Look and listen for wheezing.

v_required.err: Please enter the number of breaths

fields.label: Which of these difficult breathing symptoms does the child display?

fields.text: Give a trial of rapid acting bronchodilator up to 3 times, 15-20 minutes apart.
fields.toaster_info_text: Give a trial of rapid acting bronchodilator up to 3 times, 15-20 minutes apart.

fields.label: Did you administer the bronchodilator?

fields.text: Count the breaths per minute again and look again for wheezing and/or chest indrawing.
fields.toaster_info_text: Count the breaths per minute again and look again for wheezing and/or chest indrawing.

v_required.err: Please enter the number of breaths

fields.label: Chest indrawing stopped after administering bronchodilator?
Has the child been exposed to or is infected with HIV?

fields.text:
Child has: SEVERE PNEUMONIA OR VERY SEVERE DISEASE

- Give first dose of an appropriate antibiotic 
- Refer URGENTLY to the hospital**
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: SEVERE PNEUMONIA OR VERY SEVERE DISEASE

- Give first dose of an appropriate antibiotic 
- Refer URGENTLY to the hospital**

fields.text:
Child has: PNEUMONIA


- Give oral Amoxicillin for 5 days ***
- If wheezing (or disappeared afte rapidly acting bronchodilator) give an inhaled bronchodilator for 5 days ****
- Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy
- If coughing or more than 14 days or recurrent wheeze, refer for possible TB or asthma assessment
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 3 days
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: PNEUMONIA


- Give oral Amoxicillin for 5 days ***
- If wheezing (or disappeared afte rapidly acting bronchodilator) give an inhaled bronchodilator for 5 days ****
- Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy
- If coughing or more than 14 days or recurrent wheeze, refer for possible TB or asthma assessment
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 3 days

fields.text:
Child has: COUGH OR COLD

- If wheezing (or disappeared afte rapidly acting bronchodilator) give an inhaled bronchodilator for 5 days ****
- Soothe the throat and relieve the cough with a safe remedy
- If coughing or more than 14 days or recurrent wheeze, refer for possible TB or asthma assessment
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 5 days if not improving
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: COUGH OR COLD

- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 5 days if not improving

fields.label: Has there been cholera instances in the community or have you visited an area with cholera?

fields.text:
Child has: SEVERE DEHYDRATION
- If child has no other severe classification:
Give fluid for severe dehydration (Plan C)

OR

If child also has another severe
classification:
- Refer URGENTLY to hospital with mother
giving frequent sips of ORS on the way
- Advise the mother to continue
breastfeeding
- If child is 2 years or older and there is
cholera in your area, give antibiotic for
cholera
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: SEVERE DEHYDRATION
- If child has no other severe classification:
Give fluid for severe dehydration (Plan C)

OR

If child also has another severe
classification:
- Refer URGENTLY to hospital with mother
giving frequent sips of ORS on the way
- Advise the mother to continue
breastfeeding
- If child is 2 years or older and there is
cholera in your area, give antibiotic for
cholera

fields.text:
Child has: SOME DEHYDRATION
- Give fluid, zinc supplements, and food for some
dehydration (Plan B)

If child also has a severe classification:
- Refer URGENTLY to hospital with mother
giving frequent sips of ORS on the way
- Advise the mother to continue
breastfeeding

- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 5 days if not improving

diarrhoea at home (Plan A)
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 5 days if not improving

fields.text:
Child has: VERY SEVERE FEBRILE
DISEASE
- Give first dose of artesunate or quinine for severe malaria
- Give first dose of an appropriate antibiotic
- Give one dose of paracetamol in clinic for high fever (38.5°C or above)
- Treat the child to prevent low blood sugar
- Refer URGENTLY to hospital
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: VERY SEVERE FEBRILE
DISEASE
- Give first dose of artesunate or quinine for severe malaria
- Give first dose of an appropriate antibiotic
- Give one dose of paracetamol in clinic for high fever (38.5°C or above)
- Treat the child to prevent low blood sugar
- Refer URGENTLY to hospital

fields.text:
Child has: MALARIA
- Give recommended first line oral antimalarial
- Give one dose of paracetamol in clinic for high fever (38.5°C or above)
- Give appropriate antibiotic treatment for an identified bacterial cause
of fever
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow-up in 3 days if fever persists
- If fever is present every day for more than 7 days, refer for
assessment

- Follow-up in 3 days

fields.text:
Child has: UNCOMPLICATED SEVERE ACUTE MALNUTRITION
- Give oral antibiotics for 5 days

- Assess for possible TB infection
- Advise mother when to return immediately
- Follow up in 7 days

fields.text: Mother and child status unknown: TEST mother
fields.toaster_info_text: Mother and child status unknown: TEST mother

fields.text: Mother HIV positive and child status unknown: TEST child
fields.toaster_info_text: Mother HIV positive and child status unknown: TEST child

fields.label: What is the mother's HIV status after the test?
What is the child's HIV status after the test?

fields.text:
Child has: CONFIRMED HIV INFECTION

- Initiate ART treatment and HIV care
- Give cotrimoxazole prophylaxis*
- Assess the chil's feeding and provide appropriate counseling to the mother
- Advise the mother on home care
- Assess or refer for TB assessment at INH preventive therapy
- Follow-up regularly as per national guidelines
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child has: CONFIRMED HIV INFECTION

- Initiate ART treatment and HIV care
- Give cotrimoxazole prophylaxis*
- Assess the chil's feeding and provide appropriate counseling to the mother
- Advise the mother on home care
- Assess or refer for TB assessment at INH preventive therapy
- Follow-up regularly as per national guidelines

fields.text:
Child is: HIV EXPOSED

- Give cotrimoxazole prophylaxis
- Start or continue ARV prophylaxis as recommended
- Do virological test to confirm HIV status**
- Assess the child's feeding and provide appropriate counseling to the mother
- Advise the mother on home care
- Follow-up regularly as per national guidelines
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child is: HIV EXPOSED

- Give cotrimoxazole prophylaxis
- Start or continue ARV prophylaxis as recommended
- Do virological test to confirm HIV status**
- Assess the child's feeding and provide appropriate counseling to the mother
- Advise the mother on home care
- Follow-up regularly as per national guidelines

fields.text:
Child: HIV INFECTION UNLIKELY
- Treat, counsel and follow-up existing infections
fields.toaster_info_text:
Child: HIV INFECTION UNLIKELY
- Treat, counsel and follow-up existing infections

fields.text: HIV TREATMENT

fields.label: HIV treatment given for child:

options.text: Initiated ART treatment and HIV care
Assessed the child's feeding and provided appropriate counselling to the mother
Advised the mother on home care
Referred for TB assessment and INH preventive therapy

fields.label: HIV treatment given for exposed child:

options.text: Started or continued ARV prophylaxis as recommended
Done virological test to confirm HIV status
Assessed the child's feeding and provided appropriate counselling to the mother
Advised the mother on home care

fields.label: Treatment for HIV unlikely child:

options.text: Child treated, mother counseled and followed up for other infections
